meanings.definition: Show unnecessary or excessive concern or worry.
meanings.sent1: She fussed over every little detail of the party, making sure everything was perfect.
meanings.sent2: The mother fussed over her child, constantly checking if they were warm enough.
meanings.sent3: He fussed about the weather forecast for the picnic, afraid it might rain.
meanings.sent4: The cat fussed over its food, refusing to eat anything but fresh tuna.
meanings.sent5: Grandma fussed over her garden, tending to each plant with care and attention.

meanings.definition: Be agitated or make a fuss.
meanings.sent1: The toddler fussed when his toy was taken away, crying loudly.
meanings.sent2: The dog fussed at the mailman, barking and growling.
meanings.sent3: She fussed over her messy hair, trying to tame it with a brush.
meanings.sent4: The engine fussed before finally starting, sputtering and coughing.
meanings.sent5: The students fussed in the cafeteria, excitedly discussing the upcoming school dance.

meanings.definition: Complain or argue about something in a petty or irritating way.
meanings.sent1: He fussed about the new office seating arrangement, claiming his chair was too close to the window.
meanings.sent2: The customer fussed about the service at the restaurant, demanding to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent3: She fussed over the price of the dress, haggling with the salesperson for a discount.
meanings.sent4: The siblings fussed over who would get the last piece of cake, each claiming they deserved it more.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors fussed about the noise from the party next door, calling the police to complain.
